charges.charge_description: Did knowingly and intentionally combine, conspire, confederate, and agree with each other and others, to distribute cocaine base (crack) a schedule II controlled substance, in an amount of 50 grams or more, in violation of title 21, USC, sections 841(a)(1), (b)(1)(A) and 846

charges.charge_offence_description: Did knowingly and intentionally combine, conspire,

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant pleaded guilty to Count 1 of the Indictment on August 7, 2003. Count(s) 5 and 6 are dismissed on the oral motion of the United States. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 150 months on Count 1 of the Indictment. The Court recommends to the Bureau of Prisons: Defendant be given the opportunity to participate in the 500 hour residential substance abuse treatment program. Defendant not be incarcerated in the Kansas City area because of problems relating to his known cooperation. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term 5 years.$100 MSA. No Fine or Restitution.

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant was found guilty on Counts 1 through 5 of the Indictment on 02/10/04. Date of Imposition of sentence: August 25, 2004. IMPRISONMENT: the defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 240 months on Counts 1 through 5, to be served concurrently. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal.SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 10 years on Count 1, and 3 years on each of Counts 2 through 5, the terms to run concurrently; With Standard and Special Conditions. MSA. No Fine. No Restitution.

MSA. No Fine. No Restitution.

charges.charge_disposition: 2nd REVOCATION JUDGMENT: The defendant admitted guilt to violation of condition(s) special and standard of the term of supervision. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 11 months on Count 1 of the Indictment. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, no term of supervised release is imposed.  1st REVOCATION JUDGMENT: The defendant admitted guilt to violations of mandatory, standard and special condition(s) of the term of supervision. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of TIME SERVED. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years.  ORIGINAL SENTENCE: The defendant pleaded guilty to Count 1 of the Indictment on August 22, 2003. Count(s) 3 is dimissed on the oral motion of the United States. Date of Imposition of Sentence: November 18, 2004. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 48 months on Count 1 of the Indictment. The Court recommends to the Bureau of Prisons: Court designates defendant be designated to the Honor Camp, Greenville, IL. Court also recommends defendant be given the opportunity to participate in the 500 hour intensive drug treatment program. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons before 2:00 p.m. on December 28, 2004. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years; WITH STANDARD AND SPECIAL CONDITIONS. $100 MSA. No FINE. No RESTITUTION.
